Articles.Content: I do have a secret weapon fitted to my 'Cerberus' class heavy fighter. It's called 'Elbow' because I'm uncreative with names.

Should I upgrade the destroyer into the modern combat standards? It is already well armored.

Does my destroyer look good? I can do some aesthetic changes if required.
Stop naming missiles shredders(at least if they're 1.5m) it causes confusion.

Stop naming missiles shredders(at least if they're 1.5m) it causes confusion.

I shall name a ship class "Shredder", and it's weapons will be Destroyers

Just to be that guy

http://www./view/01cngsdxent92xz/Hydra.craft

You may begin testing against this beast's hybridized composite super-armor.

Also I built a new super-missile. It shreds everything. Including Dread and the Super Kraken Battleship.

I call it Redderhs, The World Ripper. His missiles are called Redderhs.

http://www./view/8cf8qkvd7pbjey8/Redderhs,_The_World_Ripper.craft

Post pics of the destruction.

Edited May 30, 2014 by astecarmyman

Have you tried the missiles against my prowler cruiser or the destroyer. I would like some combat data.

Or even my unsc paris class frigate. It will laugh off most strikes.
The destroyer is utterly beautiful as i said, and it's armour is very strong.
Testing my new naval warhead (How well it aims).

Here is the remains of Triumphant after being hit by another missile.

The survivors from the stolen ship have been taken below deck and are being brought back to Britannia Weaponry territory where they will be properly arrested.
My boats just look like bigger versions of each other.

That looks pretty cool:)

I base mine on real life ships, the one above was based on HMS Hood (loosely)

Could someone test the armour on my 'Achilles' Class battleship? Please?

http://www./download/3sbtg355dg1a28w/%27Achilles%27+Class+Battleship.craft#39;Achilles'_Class_Battleship.craft
I finally finished my replica, this is a lancaster bomber and i've spent most of the day building and testing it.

Now we start getting into naval warfare -.-

I'm done...
We could battle if you'd like, I'd like to see how my ships fare in real combat. However, let me warn you that I have recently built a working Ekranoplan.

Weight?

(Tenchar)

We could battle if you'd like, I'd like to see how my ships fare in real combat. However, let me warn you that I have recently built a working Ekranoplan.

What's that?
It is a surface effect airplane. The soviets were going to fly them at near waterline altitudes and fit them with huge amounts of supersonic cruise missiles to attack american aircraft carriers.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ground_effect_vehicle

I forgot what it was then remembered before google loaded.

Edited May 30, 2014 by RocketscientistV
Ctrl-V
Should I get the i7 4770k with a z97 or z87 chipset motherboard? Not sure whether or not I want to pay those devils at intel for locked features.
That was quick. From what I read you're probably gonna crash before you can attack:P
Why not fly it a bit higher. I don't think anyone in ksp can fly at those altitudes for extended periods of time without aid.

Actually building an Ekranoplan in KSP is practically impossible because ground effect isn't a thing. I said my one works because it can reach almost identical speeds and has the same look, it cant fly however due to it's stubby wings.

Here are pictures of the two variants:

'Mako' Class light Ekranoplan.

'Poseidon' Class heavy Ekranoplan.
Still in experimental stages...
